args.natural_language_statement: Let ε > 0, let p(z) be a nonconstant complex polynomial, or more generally a nonconstant power series converging in { z ∈ ℂ : |z - z0| < ε }, and suppose p(z0) ≠ 0. Then there exists a w in { z ∈ ℂ : |z - z0| < ε } such that |p(w)| < |p(z0)|. Translate to Lean4 (import Mathlib at top) and end the statement with := by sorry. Save as a theorem named jirilebl_ra_ch_approximate_2229 but it's acceptable to restrict to the polynomial case.

result:

open scoped Classical
open Polynomial
open Filter Metric Finset

/-- Let ε > 0, let p(z) be a nonconstant complex polynomial, or more generally a nonconstant power series converging in { z ∈ ℂ : |z - z0| < ε }, and suppose p(z0) ≠ 0. Then there exists a w in { z ∈ ℂ : |z - z0| < ε } such that |p(w)| < |p(z0)|. Translate to Lean4 (import Mathlib at top) and end the statement with := by sorry. Save as a theorem named jirilebl_ra_ch_approximate_

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let ε > 0, let p(z) be a nonconstant complex polynomial, or more generally a nonconstant power series converging in { z ∈ ℂ : |z - z0| < ε }, and suppose p(z0) ≠ 0. Then there exists a w in { z ∈ ℂ : |z - z0| < ε } such that |p(w)| < |p(z0)|. -/
theorem jirilebl_ra_ch_approximate_2229 {p : Polynomial ℂ} (hp : p ≠ 0) (ε : ℝ) (hε : 0 < ε)
    (z0 : ℂ) (hpz0 : p.eval z0 ≠ 0) :
    ∃ w ∈ Metric.ball z0 ε, ‖p.eval w‖ < ‖p.eval z0‖ := by sorry
